quote: Allah is with the doers of good.
So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?
Indeed, with hardship comes ease.
And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out.
And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.
And whoever relies upon Allah - then He is sufficient for him.
And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him of his matter ease.
And whoever trusts in Allah, He is sufficient for him.
And do not mix the truth with falsehood or conceal the truth while you know [it].
Do not worship except Allah ; and to parents do good and to relatives, orphans, and the needy.
And speak to people good [words] and establish prayer and give zakah.
So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me.
Indeed we belong to Allah, and indeed to Him we will return.
Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is the straight path.
Indeed, the mercy of Allah is near to the doers of good.
My mercy encompasses all things.
So when the Qurâ€™an is recited, then listen to it and pay attention that you may receive mercy.
And my success is not but through Allah.
Allah never changes the condition of a people unless they strive to change themselves.
Allah does not burden any soul greater than it can bear.
Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established.
Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.
And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.
Every soul will taste death.
